accueil.description: UNM is a Malagasy company founded in Sambava, in the heart of the SAVA region, committed to the valorization, processing, and export of Madagascar vanilla. Driven by passion and expertise…

intro.paragraphe1: UNM was founded in 2016 in Sambava, Madagascar, by a passionate entrepreneur with a unique mission: to share with the world the incomparable and unique flavor of Madagascar vanilla. Located in the north of the country, in the SAVA region, the heart of vanilla production.
intro.paragraphe2: In 2024, UNM reached a major milestone by exporting several tons of vanilla, providing stable income to about fifty workers during a particularly difficult year in Madagascar. Though our team is small, years of collaboration have built strong bonds that we consider a family.

liste: Production of the highest quality vanilla
Stability and support for around fifty workers
A close-knit team with a family spirit
Passion and commitment towards ambitious goals
quiSommesNous.citation: Over time, we have acquired unique expertise and know-how to deliver an impeccable quality product to our clients.

piliers.description: Over the years, we have developed unique know-how that allows us to turn every action into excellence and every product into a quality masterpiece.
Every decision we make, every detail we perfect, is designed to provide our clients with trust, satisfaction, and peace of mind.

etapes.description: Vanilla takes several years to develop. It takes about 3 to 4 years after planting for the first flowers to appear.
Each flower is hand-pollinated. Growers use fine sticks to unite the male and female parts of the flower, a meticulous work lasting a few seconds per flower.
After pollination, the pods take about nine months to mature before they are ready for harvest.
The pods are boiled, dried, and fermented for six months. This process develops their rich and complex aromas.
Finally, the pods are carefully sorted, graded, and packaged before being shipped worldwide.

services.intro: Vanilla is often unfairly described as simple or ordinary. Yet it is anything but that. Appreciated worldwide for its sweet, creamy, and floral notes, vanilla is the result of patience, precision, and true expertise.
services.description: Producing high-quality vanilla is meticulous work: about 5 to 7 kg of green pods are needed to obtain 1 kg of prepared vanilla, which explains why vanilla remains one of the most expensive spices in the world.

etapes.texte: Vanilla pods are carefully hand-picked once they reach full maturity to ensure optimal quality.
After blanching, the pods are exposed to tropical sunlight for several days to develop their aromas and characteristic color.
The dried pods are then ground into a fine natural powder, used in gastronomy and cosmetics.
Vanilla is sorted, graded, and carefully packaged in airtight boxes to preserve quality before export.
